tool.name: Chopper
tool.description: Filtering and trimming of long reads.
tool.command:
chopper
--input $input
#if $contam --contam $contam #end if
#if $option_params.quality --quality $option_params.quality.value #end if
#if $option_params.maxqual --maxqual $option_params.maxqual.value #end if
#if $option_params.minlength --minlength $option_params.minlength.value #end if
#if $option_params.maxlength --maxlength $option_params.maxlength.value #end if
#if $option_params.headcrop --headcrop $option_params.headcrop.value #end if
#if $option_params.tailcrop --tailcrop $option_params.tailcrop.value #end if
#if $option_params.mingc --mingc $option_params.mingc.value #end if
#if $option_params.maxgc --maxgc $option_params.maxgc.value #end if
##output capture #if $output_params.inverse == "yes" $output_params.inverse #end if
#if str($input.ext).endswith("gz") | gzip > $fq_filt #else > $fq_filt #end if

param.label: Reference FASTA
param.help: FASTA file with reference to check potential contaminants against.

param.label: Minimal quality score
param.help: Sets a minimum Phred average quality score.

param.label: Maximal quality score
param.help: Sets a maximum Phred average quality score.

param.label: Sets a minimum read length
param.help: Minimal length of read to keep.

param.label: Sets a maximum read length
param.help: Maximal length of read to keep

param.label: Headcrop
param.help: Trim N nucleotides from the start of a read.

param.label: Tailcrop
param.help: Trim N nucleotides from the end of a read.

param.label: Minimum GC content
param.help: Sets a minimum GC content for reads to keep.

param.label: Maximum GC content
param.help: Sets a maximum GC content for reads to keep.

param.label: Q-score cutoff to trim read ends
param.help: Takes a quality score and will trim the ends of the reads if they are below the specified cut-off (window-size = 1).

param.label: Output the opposite of the normal results
param.help: Reverse the output results (aka, the 'failed reads')

tool.help:
**Chopper**
Rust implementation of NanoFilt+NanoLyse, both originally written in Python. This tool, intended for long read sequencing such as PacBio or ONT, filters and trims a fastq file. Filtering is done on average read quality and minimal or maximal read length, and applying a headcrop (start of read) and tailcrop (end of read) while printing the reads passing the filter.
Compared to the Python implementation the scope is to deliver the same results, almost the same functionality, at much faster execution times. At the moment this tool does not support filtering using a sequencing_summary file.
**More Information**
- **Official Repository**: `Chopper on GitHub`_
.. _Chopper on GitHub: https://github.com/wdecoster/chopper
